page.title: 18RECREATION IN BROMPTON
page.content: Recreational provision in Brompton is for all ages but there is not a great variety.The parish council has entered the village in the'Britain in bloom' competition during 1984 & 1985.Many of the team games for adults are organised through the public houses.One of these,quoits,is an old English game played by throwing a metal ring as close to a pin in a square of clay,as possible.Brompton has a thriving soccer team.They have recently lost ther pitch at Stone Cross because the site is being used for new district council offices.For young children there is a play area called the'wreck'.The play equipment consists of a slide,swings,s climbing frame,hobby horse and a football pitch.In June a second play area is set up on the Water End green.
